Dating: CHRISTIAN PERIOD (not before); CHRISTIAN PERIOD; ISLAMIC PERIOD (not after)
Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; ENGRAVED
Name: Jug
Description: Globular jug with wide mouth, rounded rim, short neck and unstable base with convex bottom. The paste is reddish and dark ochre in colour. Exterior surface covered with a burnished grayish coating. On the surface it presents an impressed decoration with simple linear geometrical motifs on the body and stylized zoomorphic motifs on the neck.
